explanation: Before making any changes, it's important to have a backup of the original image in case you need to start over or compare changes.
title: Backup
description: Create a duplicate of the original image file to ensure you have a backup. This can be done by saving a copy of the file under a different name or in a different location. This step is crucial to prevent loss of the original image data.

explanation: Selecting the object accurately is crucial for effective removal and seamless blending with the background.
title: Select Object
description: Use selection tools such as the Lasso Tool, Quick Selection Tool, or the Pen Tool to carefully select the object you want to remove. Ensure the selection is as precise as possible to avoid affecting surrounding areas. This includes using the Quick Mask Mode and expanding the selection if necessary.

explanation: Removing the object requires filling in the area with content that matches the surrounding environment.
title: Remove Object
description: Utilize tools like the Content-Aware Fill, Patch Tool, or Clone Stamp Tool to remove the selected object. This involves replacing the object with pixels that blend seamlessly with the surrounding area, ensuring a natural look. This includes both automatic and manual content-aware fill methods.

explanation: After removal, it's important to refine the area to ensure it looks natural and consistent with the rest of the image.
title: Refine Area
description: Use tools such as the Healing Brush Tool or the Smudge Tool to smooth out any inconsistencies or artifacts left after the object removal. This step ensures the area blends well with the rest of the image. This includes using the Clone Stamp Tool with low flow and opacity for blending.

original_subgoals.title: Refine Area

explanation: Reviewing the changes helps ensure that the object removal is not noticeable and that the image looks natural.
title: Review Changes
description: Examine the edited image to ensure the object removal is seamless. Check for any visible artifacts or inconsistencies and make additional adjustments if necessary. This step is crucial for achieving a professional-looking result.

explanation: Saving the final image ensures that your work is preserved and can be used or shared as needed.
title: Save Image
description: Save the edited image in the desired format and location. Consider saving a version with layers intact for future edits, as well as a flattened version for sharing or printing. This step finalizes the editing process.

original_subgoals.title: Save Image

title: Select Sampling Area
description: Use the new Content-Aware Fill feature to manually select the area from which Photoshop should sample pixels. This involves using the eraser tool to exclude unwanted areas and ensure the fill is accurate and seamless.

original_subgoals.title: Select Sampling Area
original_subgoals.description: Use the new Content-Aware Fill feature to manually select the area from which Photoshop should sample pixels. This involves using the eraser tool to exclude unwanted areas and ensure the fill is accurate and seamless.

title: Access Beta Version
description: Open the Creative Cloud application, navigate to the Beta Apps section, and install the Photoshop Beta to access new features like the Remove Tool.

original_subgoals.title: Access Beta Version
original_subgoals.description: Open the Creative Cloud application, navigate to the Beta Apps section, and install the Photoshop Beta to access new features like the Remove Tool.

title: Open Image
description: Open the image file in Photoshop by navigating to the File menu and selecting the Open option. This step is essential to begin the editing process.
